navmid.graph
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  navmid.graph.Node
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActionNode, CallbackNode, IntNode, ListenerAssociationNode, ListenerClassNode, ListenerNode, ObjectNode, PathNode, StringNode, TestNode, TransitionNode
public class Node
extends java.lang.Object

The basic class for nodes. It is subclassed by actual graph members but defines the main behaviours of a graph node and implements the notion of graph.

Author:
piac6784

Constructor Detail

Node

protected Node(Node.Kind kind)
Create a new node with a unique id and an initial empty lists of linked nodes. The node is registered in the current graph. The constructor is never called directly (an exception is the graph node). Only specific kind of nodes are created. This is controlled by the subclasses.

Parameters:
kind -
Method Detail

init

public static void init()
Initialize the graph with a unique graph node. Called once, but could also be used to reset the graph (giving it a new anchor).

graph

public static Node graph()
Gives back the graph identified by its root node.

Returns:
the root of the graph

kind

public Node.Kind kind()
Gives back the kind defining the purpose of this node in the graph.

Returns:
the kind.

linkTo

public void linkTo(Node n)
Establish a transition to another node, with this node as origin and the other as destnation.

Parameters:
n - The destination node of the link.

delete

public void delete()
Remove a node from the graph. All the nodes linked to it are modified to reflect the changes in the links.

dests

public java.util.List<Node> dests(Node.Kind kind)
Gives back all the nodes that are destinations of a transition starting from this node filtered on a given kind.

Parameters:
kind - The filtered kind or ANY if there is no filtering.
Returns:
A list of nodes.

origins

public java.util.List<Node> origins(Node.Kind kind)
Gives back all the nodes that are sources of a transition ending to this node filtered on a given kind.

Parameters:
kind - The filtered kind or ANY if there is no filtering.
Returns:
A list of nodes.

all

public static java.util.List<Node> all(Node.Kind kind)
Gives back all the nodes of the graph of a given kind (or all the nodes if the kind is ANY).

Parameters:
kind - The filtered kind or ANY if there is no filtering.
Returns:
A list of nodes of the given kind or all the nodes if ANY was used.

dumpCurrentGraph

public static void dumpCurrentGraph(java.io.PrintStream out)
Debug function used to print the graph on an output stream. We print for each node its short content (toString) and the contents of the nodes it is linked to.

Parameters:
out - The printstream on which the result is printed.

defaultColor

public java.awt.Color defaultColor()
Gives back the default color associated to the class of objects. This method is usually overridden by subclasses. It is recommended to use soft default color and use bright colors for temporary events.

Returns:
this default color

bgColor

public java.awt.Color bgColor()
The background color as queried by the graph displayer. Gives back the default color associated to the node class unless a temporary color has been set for this specific node.

Returns:
The color of the background of the cell representing the node.

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
Set the local temporary color associated to this object

Parameters:
color - An AWT color object or null to reset to the default color.

colorName

public static java.lang.String colorName(java.awt.Color color)
A utility to transform an AWT color in a string coding the color in classical HTML format also usable by dot.

Parameters:
color - an AWT color representation as used internally.
Returns:
a string usable to represent the color in dot.

dumpToDot

public static void dumpToDot(java.io.PrintStream out,
                             java.util.Set<Node.Kind> restriction)
A method to generate a dot file from the graph. The file is usually processed by dot to generate a postscript file. This is a debug method.

Parameters:
out -
restriction - The set of nodes we went to make visible. Use null for no restriction. The other sensible value is visible

htmlProtect

@NonNull
public static java.lang.String htmlProtect(java.lang.String s)
A utility function that escapes all the potentially interpretable HTML characters so that it can be displayed in a browser without problem.

Parameters:
s - the original string.
Returns:
the escaped string.

getToolTip

public java.lang.String getToolTip()
Gives back the text in HTML format that is displayed in the tooltip associated to the node. This is usually a longer version of what is given back by toString.

Returns:
The text displayed.
